page.title: 08Kinmount House-3
page.content:
It sits on top of its mound of earth and only on close inspection do you notice the damp riddled walls, the cracked stone, the smashed windows, etc.,etc.
The history of this house, built in honey coloured Cumberland sandstone is interspersed with the royal and ducal families from the not so disatant past. From 1812 until approximately 1930 the house was owned by the dukes of Buccleuch and Queensberry and then in that decade the house was sold to a member of the Brooks family.This family who had played a large part in World War I were very friendly with the then Duke of Gloucester and it was while he was hunting with Colonel Brook that he was supposed to have been told about his uncles (George VI) failing health.
